name: Benjamin J. Blalock
content: Benjamin Blalock's home page Benjamin J. Blalock, Associate Professor Ph.D., Georgia Institute of Technology, 1996 Awarded the Eta Kappu Nu Outstanding Teacher Award, Dept. of Electrical & Computer Engineering, The University of Tennessee, April 2002 Engineering Research Fellow Award, The University of Tennessee, 2005 & 2006 Academic/Research and Field Interests: Analog/Mixed-Signal Integrated Circuit Design Analog/Mixed-Signal IC Design for Extreme Environments Ultra Low Voltage CMOS IC Design Multi-gate transistors and circuit applications Bio-microelectronics Background Summary: (click here) Current Research Students & Research Activity: I direct the Integrated Circuits & Systems Laboratory in the Min H. Kao Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at The University of Tennessee. Our current research focus includes analog IC design for extreme environments, mixed-signal/mixed-voltage circuit design for systems-on-a-chip in SOI technology, multi-gate transistors and circuits on SOI, body-driven circuit techniques for ultra low-voltage CMOS analog, and bio-microelectronics.
